CommandDefinition.Name: modifytimecontrolledorder
CommandDefinition.Description: Modify an existing Time Controlled Order.

XynaCommandLineCommand.ExtendedDescription: The calendarDefinition can be specified as a list of time units with conditions, separated by semicolons and enclosed by square brackets. The following time units are allowed: Millisecond, Second, Minute, Hour, Day, DayOfMonth, Month, Year. Examples: * [Hour=20;Minute=15;DayOfWeek=SAT] starts every Saturday at 20:15 an order * [Hour=:2] starts every two hours an order * [Day=2#MON;Month=JAN] starts always on the second Monday in January an order

Argument.Name: id
Argument.Description: The ID of the Time Controlled Order to be modified.

Argument.Name: label
Argument.Description: A name for the Time Controlled Order

Argument.Name: orderType
Argument.Description: The ordertype of the order to be started by the Time Controlled Order

Argument.Name: calendarDefinition
Argument.Description: Times at which the order will be executed.

Argument.Name: firstExecutionTime
Argument.Description: Date and time of the first execution. Use the value '0' to execute immediately. Supported inputs are ISO Timestamp YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[,f] and the milliseconds since 1970 for absolute times. For relative times only milliseconds since 1970 are supported.

Argument.Name: timeZone
Argument.Description: Time zone associated with the first execution time. Only valid if the interval is a multiple of 24h. If no time zone is provided the first execution time is assumed to be in UTC.

Argument.Name: dst
Argument.Description: If the provided time zone has daylight saving time, then it is taken into account when executing intervals that are multiple of days.

Argument.Name: enabled
Argument.Description: Enable or disable the order. Allowed values are true and false.

Argument.Name: onError
Argument.Description: Behavior if an error occurs. Allowed values are 'Disable', 'Drop' and 'Ignore'.

Argument.Name: custom0
Argument.Description: Sets the custom0 field for the Time Controlled Order.

Argument.Name: custom1
Argument.Description: Sets the custom1 field for the Time Controlled Order.

Argument.Name: custom2
Argument.Description: Sets the custom2 field for the Time Controlled Order.

Argument.Name: custom3
Argument.Description: Sets the custom3 field for the Time Controlled Order.
